title: WeWork’s CEO Is Under Pressure From the Board, Report Says
text:
Text size

Photograph by Timothy A. Clary/AFP/Getty Images

WeWork’s parent company is limping toward a potential public offering, and now its chief executive is in the crosshairs.

Some member’s of the board of WeWork’s parent company, We Co., are pushing for Adam Neumann to give up his title and possibly take the role of nonexecutive chairman, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing sources it didn’t identify. In a profile last week, the Journal detailed allegations of self-dealing and drug use by the CEO.

The newspaper said Neumann declined to comment, citing a quiet period ahead of the planned IPO.
description: The Wall Street Journal reported that some members of the board at We Co., WeWork’s parent company, want him to give up his title and potentially take the role of nonexecutive chairman.
